ETYMOLOGY: Compound word combining 'week' (from Old English wice or wucu) and 'end' (from Old English ende). It refers to the end of the working week.
SINCE: c. 1820s (became widespread in the late 19th century with standardized leisure time)

MEANINGS.PATTERN: [the] weekend | on/at the weekend | this weekend
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The period of time comprising Saturday and Sunday, often extended to Friday evening, typically regarded as a time for rest and leisure.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 周末；一周的最后两天（周六和周日），通常是休息、休闲或不工作的时间。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: What are your plans for the upcoming long weekend?
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 你对即将到来的长周末有什么计划？
